title: Compiler panic with missing (inherited?) associated types

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
Two incomplete trait implementations triggered a compiler panic, when I was waiting for a compiler error to guide me on what to implement.

I've distilled my code down to this example:

```toml
[dependencies]
hyper = { git = "https://github.com/hyperium/hyper.git", ref = "43cf9aefe8f9147a0f08aa0f9d609d275549fd7c" }
```

```rust
// src/main.rs

extern crate hyper;

use hyper::client;

struct TestConnect {}

impl client::Service for TestConnect {}
impl client::Connect for TestConnect {}

fn main() {}
```

I expected to see a compile error, though I'm not sure what the error would / should have said.

Instead, this happened:

```
error: internal compiler error: /Users/rustbuild/src/rust-buildbot/slave/stable-dist-rustc-mac/build/src/librustc/traits/project.rs:1018: Tried to project an inherited associated type during coherence checking, which is currently not supported.

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box<Any>', /Users/rustbuild/src/rust-buildbot/slave/stable-dist-rustc-mac/build/src/librustc_errors/lib.rs:375
note: Run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace.
```

## Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:

```
rustc 1.16.0 (30cf806ef 2017-03-10)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 30cf806ef8881c41821fbd43e5cf3699c5290c16
commit-date: 2017-03-10
host: x86_64-apple-darwin
release: 1.16.0
LLVM version: 3.9
```

Backtrace:

